programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Devastating floods trap residents in Australia, a base jumper gets stranded in freezing temperatures and a destructive hailstorm batters Texas.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Experts investigate how 80 people died when the Express Samina sank near the Greek island of Paros, and how it hit a rock that rose 25 metres out of the sea.

programme.title: Greatest Moments in Football
programme.sub-title: Bring Me the Head of Diego Maradona
programme.desc: Documentary about Diego Maradona, a talented and accomplished player, but recalled by many for directing a goal into the England net using his hand at the 1986 World Cup.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant jobs of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant jobs of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The hunters try a new method for fighting back at poachers. Meanwhile, another team engages in some risky open water hunting.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One hunter gives his deckhand more than he bargained for when he forgets his bullet clip, and another team goes in pursuit of a huge and terrifying gator.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a 1972 telegram that prevents Muhammad Ali from fighting in Alaska, and a first edition copy of Oscar Wilde's The Happy Prince arrives in store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1957 Harley-Davidson Sportster roars into the shop, and Rick takes a look at a painting of Vietnamese Communist leader Ho Chi Minh.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Panellists Sarah Millican, Eddie Kadi, Noel Fielding and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry mucks about with a messy mixture of M-themed matters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sean Lock, Romesh Ranganathan, Marcus Brigstocke
programme.desc: Eight Out of 10 Cats star Sean Lock hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by grumpy stand-up Romesh Ranganathan and actor and funnyman Marcus Brigstocke.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Tom Allen and political commentator Ayesha Hazarika joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian performs another round of witty stand-up shows, beginning as he gets involved in shredding some naughty magazines, helps a gerbil to fulfil its destiny, and is surprised by the pictures that develop from an old-fashioned camera he finds.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave Gorman performs another of his witty stand-up shows, looking at 'fun facts', the public's perception of Richard Branson and why David Dickinson must be stopped in his tracks.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads encounter a fellow Brit while spending a relaxing weekend in the country - but his hunger, exhaustion and evasive behaviour arouse their suspicions. Ray Winstone guests alongside regulars Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Jupiter is big, very dangerous and has moons as big as planets, but the more we learn we must conclude this giant is less of a planet and more of a failed star.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: The political divide between sisters Jessica and Diane Mitford, one of whom abandoned high society to embrace communism while the other married fascist leader Oswald Mosely.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: A famous attempt to fake the missing link between ape and man, which went unquestioned for 40 years with serious consequences for the study of evolution.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Unearthing WWII
programme.desc: Historian David O'Keefe and filmmaker Wayne Abbott explore battlefields to investigate unsolved mysteries, beginning with one of the sites of the Normandy Landings.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Ruxton, a physician who lived a quiet, respectable life in Lancaster, until in 1935 he beat, strangled and stabbed his wife and housemaid to death.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where items featured include an early camera which had previously been used for natural history photography, a dagger with a gruesome history, a shawl that once belonged to a movie star, and a small 18th-century figurine.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned prison beneath the water, a tunnel in the heart of a mountain, concrete towers hidden in the woods and a rusting coastal relic.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a railway journey through the Republic of Ireland from Co Kerry to the city of Galway. On the first leg, he travels from Killarney to Cobh, sampling 19th-century delicacies and exploring a stunning landscape that achieved fame due to rails and royals.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Charleville, Co Cork, to the city of Waterford, along the way finding out about the ancient art of making butter, attempting to learn the basics of Ireland's oldest game, and riding on the Duke of Devonshire's Victorian railway.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris crosses Australia from south to north following the original ill-fated route of the 2,000 mile-long Adelaide to Darwin railway. After beginning his journey on a luxury modern train, he transfers to one of the line's surviving steam locomotives before hitting the Outback, where he quickly concludes that a 4x4 is a more practical means of travelling. He passes through ghost towns and explores abandoned railway relics before uncovering why most of the southern section of the line eventually had to be abandoned. At Alice Springs he hitches a ride on a freight train headed for Darwin and reaches his final destination after nearly 24 hours in the cramped cab.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Dennis does his bit to cement Anglo-German relations by taking Dagmar for a quiet weekend away. Unfortunately for him, Wayne and Barry blunder in at the crucial moment and reduce his planned seduction to a building-site get-together.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads encounter a fellow Brit while spending a relaxing weekend in the country - but his hunger, exhaustion and evasive behaviour arouse their suspicions. Ray Winstone guests alongside regulars Jimmy Nail, Kevin Whately and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright loses his trousers on the way to the wedding of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's niece, and ends up having to borrow a pair of her trousers to wear at the event.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright comes up with a cunning plan and invents a Saint's day so that Granville can check the pockets of a foreign visitor who he suspects of shoplifting.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lieutenant Colonel Philip Drysdale, the new CO, arrives with his traditional views on army life and is unimpressed the attitude of B Company's men.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Suspected gay serial killers John Lord and Michael Keenan are brought in for questioning. In spite of the stack of circumstantial evidence against them, a confession looks a long way off as the detectives get deeply embroiled in a battle of wits. Phil Hunter is stunned when wife Cindy breaks down in his arms with news about her IVF treatment.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sam confronts Chrissie over her distant behaviour towards him, while Faye Morton hopes for help from Jac and Joseph in her bid to secure a nurse's position at the hospital. Elliot is angry when Joseph tells a patient with an inoperable condition that they can help her, but realises a new approach to the illness could hold the answer. Medical drama, starring Patsy Kensit and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Holly bravely returns to work, determined to carry on as normal, but her resolve soon cracks as the police start asking questions around A&E, prompting her to retreat back to the safety of her flat. Meanwhile, Charlie keeps a watchful eye on the cocky new receptionist, and Josh finally plucks up the courage to ask Colette for a date. Sandra Huggett and Ian Kelsey star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill relief bid a final farewell to murdered colleague Lance Powell and Adam Okaro's funeral address is all the more moving for a spell on the beat alongside Laura Bryant. Nadir and Sim investigate a well known footballer accused of rape and discover he has form - as does the witness who gave his name to the police. A routine drugs bust turns into a free-for-all when the dealer's henchmen turn up in numbers at the critical moment.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Furious about the recent run-in with Jimmy, Grant is ripe for revenge. Ricky discovers that his work brings him closer to home. Mark gives Michelle some brotherly advice.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant is eager to get his hands on Jimmy, but Phil has a better plan of revenge. Michelle sits her first exam at college. Pat prepares to take on Mike's insurance company.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are sent on a standby mission, which brings back painful memories for Carole. Meanwhile, the watch trial a new quieter siren.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack suspects a patient of malingering and Beth becomes embroiled in a family dispute when one of her patients suffers a heart attack. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David and Anna's plans for a romantic weekend away are shattered when their family and friends decide to join them, and Luke has an important question for Megan. Meanwhile, Billy faces up to Sally's death and Zoe crosses swords with feisty local Gaynor, who is intent on cleaning up the canal. Guest starring Celia Imrie.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.sub-title: Wipe That Smile Off Your Tape
programme.desc: Sharon joins a video dating agency and asks Darren to shoot a rehearsal tape, while Garth buys tickets for a Rolling Stones concert.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey injures her back, but soon recovers when DeVere invites her on a skiing trip. However, when the entrepreneur gives her advance lessons on the estate, he manages to end up the invalid. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Last Surviving Maurice Chevalier Impression
programme.desc: Compo decides the way to win the heart of Nora Batty is to become a celebrity, so goes on a televised talent show. Gorden Kaye ('Allo 'Allo!) guest stars, alongside Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy tries to defy his age by entering the annual barrel-rolling competition, and undergoes a gruelling training programme. Meanwhile, Pearl buys Howard a tropical fish tank as a gift. Long-running rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde and Juliette Kaplan.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives are called out to a robbery where a security guard is found dead. As they try to determine whether his demise was an accident or murder, they expose a complex web of deception among his friends - or enemies. Meanwhile, Lateef uncovers evidence of an international exchange racket. Art Malik guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox.

programme.title: Last Laugh in Vegas
programme.desc: Comedians Cannon and Ball, Bernie Clifton, Kenny Lynch and Mick Miller, join forces with musicians Bobby Crush, Jess Conrad, Anita Harris and actress Su Pollard to stage their dream gig in Nevada. For two weeks they'll live together, explore the city and rehearse with Las Vegas producer Frank Marino, preparing for the biggest performance of their lives in one of the area's most iconic theatres.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team head to Lincoln, where Fay Rutter appraises some Beatles memorabilia, Tony Geering dithers over an oil lamp and Helen Gardiner sends a Rolex watch to auction - where it is well received.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Bristol University answer questions on lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Quiz, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon and Tracey suspect that Dorien is fast approaching a big birthday and decide that, whether she likes it or not, the event calls for a celebration. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: In this penultimate episode - filmed by his wife Alison - Alan creates a cutting garden in the veg plot, with flowers to pick for the home from summer until the first frost. Frances Tophill moves ever closer to finishing the makeover of her tiny plot in Folkestone, while Katie Rushworth stays indoors to grow soil-free herbs in a beginners' guide to hydroponics. In the Midlands, David Domoney constructs a homemade cold-frame to grow some exotic family favourites - sweet potatoes and aubergines.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Fingerprints at the crime scene lead DI Hardy and DS Miller to a shocking suspect in Danny's murder - his father. When questioned, Mark explains he had been there recently to repair a boiler, but his alibi for the night of the murder quickly falls apart. Meanwhile, Steve Connelly approaches Beth claiming to have a message - from her dead son. Detective drama, starring David Tennant, Olivia Colman, Andrew Buchan, Jodie Whittaker and Will Mellor.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: Euro 96 England v Germany - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces action from the semi-final at Wembley Stadium, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Bob Wilson presented the coverage, with analysis from Glenn Hoddle, Jack Charlton and John Barnes, and commentary by Brian Moore and Kevin Keegan.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster.

programme.desc: The boys are back in town! Check out all the hits from some of our favourite men in pop music.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Following Nasa's discovery that something strange is on Saturn's largest moon, experts investigate the possibility of alien life feeding on electric atmosphere.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.desc: A missing mummified body could re-write the history of Abraham Lincoln's assassination, as Ramy Romany investigates whether John Wilkes Booth actually escaped.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: A buried monument offers new evidence about a huge Biblical mystery. A giant shadow engulfs the Pacific Ocean, and strange circular lake is home to unearthly life.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: An examination of the Teutul family history, with Paul Sr reminiscing about his childhood and the start of his career at Orange County Ironworks.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: A storm threatens to shut down Era Alaska's operations, Ben Pedersen faces dangerous conditions and Erik Snuggerud resorts to drastic measures to deliver medicine to a village.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the sticky task of tofu making, and finds out what happens when a TV monitor is destroyed.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind carbon dioxide cartridges, pretzels, scissor lifts and skating rinks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How professional ice-hockey players' sticks are manufactured, as well as treadmills and baby shoes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How Major League baseball bats are made, the construction of the world's fastest sports car and the technology that allows planes to land on the aircraft carrier USS Nimitz.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove are in the Queen's realm as they visit a shed in the shadow of Windsor Castle. Will they find a royal bargain of a motorcycle?.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Back in Northern Ireland, bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove discover some lovely vintage cars as well as some modern motors. What will they take home?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Jake's dark secret triggers a fist-fight that throws Edgar's new captaincy into jeopardy. Meanwhile, tempers flare when Elliott grows wise to Junior's devious ways. Documentary following the successes and failures of crewmen as they risk harsh conditions and fierce competition in the course of their work catching the valuable crustaceans.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Boulder Boys Aaron and Ron almost lose their $60,000 excavator on unstable ground. Off-the-grid opal hunting family The McFarlanes race a storm in Lightning Ridge.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, a community centre is crushed. Plus, in Berkshire a scrap artist works on a challenging new piece and in Coventry car parts are repurposed.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a painting of a wintry Parisian scene, a complicated barometer clock, and a treasured children's tricycle.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini races his 1958 Tojeiro Climax in the Hershey Grand Ascent and the VSCCA Vintage Fall Finale at Lime Rock Park.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a 1941 Lincoln, a 1929 Pierce-Arrow and a Panhard to auction and bids on a Rolls Royce Phantom 3 for a client.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jason Plato try to find a decent new car for just 10,000. Vicki Butler-Henderson checks out the new Lamborghini Urus, and the team finds the biggest BMW ever made, the new X7.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Boulder Boys Aaron and Ron almost lose their $60,000 excavator on unstable ground. Off-the-grid opal hunting family The McFarlanes race a storm in Lightning Ridge.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: King Crab season comes to an end and the fleet pull up their last pots. Rookie captain Jake Anderson struggles with the decision to leave the Northwestern. Documentary following life aboard ship in the Alaskan crab-fishing fleet.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: With a jam-packed farmhouse, killer barn, and rare rat rod Rolls Royce, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive Ohio collection has mega-pick potential.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Dorset, Drew Pritchard visits a showroom full of mid-20th century items, including a pair of 1960s Danish leather chairs. He also visits an Austin Healey and Porsche classic car restorer.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Preston, a job centre is demolished and in Yeovil a 20ft yacht is ripped to pieces. Plus, in the Somerset village of Woolavington, a sculptor is on the hunt for scrap material.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer purchases a Mini Moke, which was designed as an off-road military vehicle, for expert mechanic Edd China to work on - before trying to sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Desperate for a find, the Bushmen gamble on a dangerous mining method deep below ground. In Lightning Ridge an injury causes The Bros a serious setback.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard locks horns with a fellow dealer over a buffalo's skull in Oxfordshire. Plus, a private girls' school in Hertfordshire seeks top marks for its haul of furniture.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Young Guns risk it all to find rare pineapple opal. Meanwhile, the Boulder Boys take on deadly ground and the Bushmen face a race to the hospital.

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Tension mounts as the end of mining season nears and the Jade City crew grows anxious to find that elusive million-dollar boulder. And Josh clashes with the crew..

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Sub-zero temperatures challenge the Jade City miners rushing to find a jade boulder big enough to impress the investors before the season ends..

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Examining how rosebuds are turned into Turkish delight, and how sunscreen is made to block out harmful UV light. Plus, how to hammer out a silver spoon.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the world's finest canvases are created, how tofu is made, and how to get 50 drinks out of a single bottle of beer.

programme.title: The World's Fattest Man - A Love Story
programme.desc: The former 'World's Fattest Man' Paul Mason seeks a surgeon to remove the excess skin after his 700lbs weight loss. As he struggles through his weight-loss journey, he finds love.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic detectives demonstrate how killers who spill even a drop of blood always run the risk of leaving themselves open to identification. Plus, an incident involving a woman struck by a train.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of nursing student Michelle Le, whose body was found in a remote Californian canyon four months after she disappeared in May 2011. Giselle Esteban was later found guilty of murdering the 26-year-old after she became jealous of her relationship Le had with the father of her child.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 66-year-old Sharron Erickson, who was raped and murdered in the small Midwestern town of Colon, Nebraska in June 2003. James Marrs, who lived just 75 feet away, was later found guilty of the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the armed robbery of a Seattle bank, in which one of the gunmen was killed by police fire and the other escaped after assaulting a family.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Lieutenant Scott uncovers an illegal cache of constrictor snakes, raising concerns that the deadly predators are being traded, and an abused dog fights for its life.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour hijacks an appointment, leaving consultant Nicky to ensure the bride's voice is heard. Meanwhile, another bride tries to convince her sister to wear red.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Southern bride Shaina expected shopping for an outfit to be easy - until her mother and brother start arguing over dress styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Hannah wants a wedding gown to match the style of her icon Grace Kelly, but the bride-to-be's sister prefers something modern and sexy.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits with a passion for transforming unloved items head to an antiques market in Beziers near France's Mediterranean coast. Lorna makes tin bins into retro seats, Tracy gives a mirrored hallstand a new look, while Andrew turns hundreds of keys into original homewares.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals for which owners Lynette and David want big money. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An investigator intervenes at a private animal shelter for 600 dogs, trying to persuade the owner she should reduce numbers in the pack.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Officers fight to save a sick and neglected horse.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Sometimes blood relations lead to bloodshed - when murder becomes a family affair. Here, investigators turn to forensics to uncover sinister plots within families.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.sub-title: Hard Life in the Big Easy
programme.desc: The case of 39-year-old Dana Pastor, who disappeared in 2002 after telling friends she had decided to leave her adopted home town of New Orleans. When Hurricane Katrina struck in 2005, her mummified corpse was discovered in a wooden trunk.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of interior designer William 'Billy' McGrath, a self-made millionaire, who went missing in August 2009. His body was located two years later, buried under a house, some months after handyman Brad Tocker had been arrested on suspicion of fraud and identification theft.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: In 2004, a 31-year-old nurse died suddenly of kidney failure. When detectives looked into the affairs of her overly grieving husband, they discovered a web of lies and forgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer faces a dilemma, and a bride's friends are not sure what to make of her over-the-top dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride looks for a dress that both she and her grandmother are happy with, while another customer wants to pay tribute to her own late grandmother with her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer tries to reconcile her personal style with her desire to be a very traditional bride, and another woman hopes her grandmother approves of her choice.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Won the Battle Against My Twin
programme.desc: A bride tries to get her twin sister's approval of her dress, while another customer needs all four of her siblings to agree with her choice of gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a colourful gown to go with her theme for the big day, but her mother has other ideas. A customer looks for a dress that will make a dramatic impression.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: High School Musical star Corbin Bleu helps his fiancee choose a dress, while a bride disagrees with her fiance over the style of gown.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: The Last Time I Saw My Mother, I Was Five Years Old
programme.desc: A man searches for his birth mother, who disappeared when he was five years old. Plus, a woman hopes to meet her biological family.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Benji fears he will suffer the same fate as older brother David, who is now 700lbs. They embark on their weight loss journey together.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: The adoption of Robyn's kids is nearly complete - the Browns just need to convince a judge.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A couple plan a wedding in a castle, and have very specific ideas about what they want it to be like.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A prisoner breaks free from jail, prompting a multi-agency manhunt following a trail of burglaries, kidnappings and car thefts.
